content: OA.Report supports impact tracking for cOAlition S and delivers compliance checks across all member organizations
ShareYourPaper Permissionsâ€™ integration with the Journal Checker Tool reaches 1 million uses by authors finding a way to make their work open
OA.Support supports over 1,000 authors to make their work available
IFLA takes over the long-term running of RSCVD as a free international interlibrary loan system
The OA.Works team grows, with staff based in the USA, UK, India, and New Zealand, advancing the mission around the clock
OA.Report is adopted by several funders, mentioned in major media outlets, and opens up free reports to funders
OA.Works adopts and shares its Articles of Governance to deepen its commitment to building open-source, values-driven, nonprofit tools for the long term
Founders Pledge supports OA.Report
OA.Works turns ten ðŸŽ‚
OA.Works joins Code for Science & Society as a fiscally sponsored project
The OA.Works Advisory Committee is formed to help govern growing work
At a United Nations library event, ShareYourPaper joins a campaign to help climate scientists unlock their papers and accelerate progress on climate change
Robert Wood Johnson Foundation begins supporting OA.Report
The Open Access Button rebrands as OA.Works, reflecting its growing portfolio of open access tools
Plan S releases the Journal Checker Tool backed by our permissions data
ShareYourPaper For Libraries is released
OA.Works receives funding from the Gates Foundation to support OA.report, OA.support, and ShareYourPaper
OA.Report & OA.Support are launched to support organizations in measuring and implementing their Open Access policies
RSCVD is released, built in partnership with IFLA, to help respond to libraries closing during Covid
Arcadia Fund increases its financial support to $1.8 million over four years
ShareYourPaper is built and released in partnership with Montana State University
InstantILL is built and released in partnership with IUPUI
Open Access Button Permissions Checker is released
The first libraries begin backing our tools financially through a Leadership tier
Arcadia Fund supports Open Access Button with $440,000 grant
DeliverOA, EmbedOA, and OAsheet are released to help libraries save money and time on ILL
Direct2AAM is released, documenting a novel way to help authors make their papers Open Access
Jisc funds exploration for using Open Access materials as a part of Interlibrary Loan to deliver cost savings and faster results
The Open Access Button collects its 10,000<sup>th</sup> story
The Open Data Button is released
Open Access Button is awarded the SPARC Innovator Award
OA.Works joins SPARC to be incubated as an independently managed and funded sub-project of SPARC
Right To Research Coalition and Open Society Foundation fund more early tool development
Open Access Button is updated to be able to find open access versions and email authors requests
Open Access Button is first released, capturing thousands of stories of people hitting paywalls
